feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:58PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Friday into Saturday... Elevated surf will develop Friday and continue into Saturday. Northwest winds of 20 to 30 mph are expected Friday into Saturday causing waves to wash up near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:57PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Through Saturday... Elevated surf will continue into Saturday. Southwest winds of 20 to 35 mph will continue today, then turn northerly tonight and and decrease on Friday, then increase into Saturday. This will cause waves to wash near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:57PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds Saturday... West winds gusting to 50 mph are expected Saturday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 04 at 3:37PM AKDT until August 07 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM SATURDAY TO 6 AM AKDT SUNDAY... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a High Surf Advisory, which is in effect from 2 AM Saturday to 6 AM AKDT Sunday. * LOCATION...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued August 04 at 3:28PM AKDT until August 06 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Total snow accumulations of 8 inches are possible above 3000 feet, with 2 to 4 inches from 2000 to 3000 feet. * WHERE...Northeastern Brooks Range above 2000 feet.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 12:43PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN FRIDAY AND SATURDAY... An atmospheric river will affect the northern half of Southeast Alaska Friday through Saturday night. This system will produce heavy preciptiation along with gusty winds. Storm total rain amounts will range from 1.0 to 3.5 inches through Sunday morning, with the heaviest rain falling Friday afternoon through Saturday. The heavy

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued August 04 at 2:25PM PDT until August 08 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON SUNDAY TO 8 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...High temperatures 97 to 102. Low temperatures 60 to 70. * WHERE...In Oregon, Greater Portland Metro Area, Upper Hood River Valley, Western Columbia River Gorge and Central Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, Greater Vancouver Area, Western Columbia River Gorge and Central Columbia River Gorge.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Columbia River Gorge; Greater Vancouver Area; Western Columbia River Gorge

entry.title: Flood Watch issued August 04 at 10:01PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky, southeast Ohio, southwest Virginia and West Virginia, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Boyd, Carter, Greenup and Lawrence KY. entry.title: Heat Advisory issued August 04 at 1:52PM MDT until August 05 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions expected. Daytime highs will climb to near 103 degrees with overnight lows falling into the upper 60s and lower 70s. * WHERE...Much of east central Wyoming and western Nebraska Panhandle. * WHEN...Until 9 PM MDT Friday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County
